original: Carlberg, Adolf Torsten, läroverkis-adjun.kt, Göteborg, f. 3/3/06 i By, Kop-parb. il., av pred. A. F. C. o. h. h., i. Lindgren. G. 38 m. Marianne Rosen-hagen. Barn: Gunnar f. 38, Jan Gustav 40, Anne 42. — Stud:ex. i Skara 26, fil. mag. i Gbg 32, provår v. Vasa h. a. 1. i Gbg 40. Div. vik. i Falköp., Lysekil, Luleå, Sundsvall o. Gbg, lektor i sv. i Greifswald 36-41, e. adj. v. Gbgs östra realsk. 41-42, e. o. adj. v. Hvitfeldtska h. a. 1. i Gbg 42-45, adj. v. Majornas h. a. 1. där sed. 45. Res. t. Tyskl., Span., Ital. o. Nordafr.
translated: Carlberg, Adolf Torsten, high school teacher's assistant, Gothenburg, born March 3, 1906 in By, Kopparsberg county, son of the preacher A. F. C. and his wife H. H., nee Lindgren. Married Marianne Rosenhagen in 1938 and has three children: Gunnar, born 1938, Jan Gustav, born 1940, and Anne, born 1942. He passed the studentexamen in Skara in 1926, and graduated as a Master of Arts in Gothenburg in 1932. He worked as a substitute teacher in Falköping, Lysekil, Luleå, Sundsvall and Gothenburg, and as a Swedish lecturer in Greifswald from 1936 to 1941. He was a part-time teacher at the East Gothenburg high school in 1941-1942, and then a temporary teacher at Hvitfeldtska high school from 1942 to 1945. Since 1945, he has been a teacher at Majornas high school. He has traveled to Germany, Spain, Italy, and North Africa.
